name: Holy Reaper: Paladin 15/Champion of Torm 18/Weapon Master 7
author: KailPendragon

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Since the BW Legacy builds have been reposted for the benefit of all on these boards, I wanted to re-share my own take on one of those: the Damage Adept. I guess it would be fun to come up with other "revised" legacy builds.



******************************



A playable version of the Damage Adept and of its predecessor Paladin 17/CoT 18/WM 5 by cdaulepp, this build goes up to Great Smite V, "sacrificing" maximum damage output for increased playability. Not that the maximum damage you can dish out is all that bad, honestly

The Holy Reaper is a great boss killer that can hold his own in regular fights thanks to his buffs. HPs are kinda low unfortunately, Boots of Striding are definitely on your wish list along with STR and CHA gear (belts, gloves, cloacks and helmets mostly)

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Heya, I have some feedback on this build, although preliminary as I am in a bit of a hurry.

I would change the spread a bit, in order to benefit more from the Pally spells. Most of the slots are on 15-20, so I'd prefer dropping saves and one Epic Bonus Feat from CoT 18 to go Paladin 23 CoT 10 WM 7. That way you would regain one of the lost CoT Epic Bonus Feats as a Pally Bonus Feat, you can drop Great Smite 5 and be happy with many more buffs and spells per day. A 14 WIS 20th level pally gets 4 4 3 3 spells per day from 1 to 4, whereas yours IIRC would have 3 2 1 1. I find that even with the extra spells, most of the time you still find yourself wanting more spells, even more so without UMD, which is the case here.

I'll look at feat selection and statpoint distribution when I have more time.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, continuing my dissection, I see a feat starvation problem here, because not only does this build want a lot with pre-epic feats like DM DS and Extra Smiting, besides all WM requirements, but also in epics, with Great Smiting. I'd be inclined to drop WM altogether or Great Smiting (at least a few of those). You can go Pal 29 CoT 10 Monk or Rogue 1 for a more efficient Great Smiter (more feats to acquire Great Smites and more levels to count on them), or go Pal 26 CoT 10 Fighter 4 and get WS and EWS plus 2 more feats from Fighter 1 and 2. In both alternatives you can get Armor Skin and more Great Charismas to boost DM and DS and use all CoT Bonus Feats for Great Smites, not mentioning the stats, 5 points from DEX alone could be freed. It's a good build, though, and you managed to make good choices with the little room you had due to feat starvation, but most impressively, you managed to come up with a build that's even MORE FEAT STARVED than my Holy Weapon Master with Cheese!

Take it EZ!

Take it EZ!

You have to keep the aim of the build in mind: this is a "damage adept" maybe playable. That meant getting EWF, EP, IC and Extra smiting in addition to WM 7 (extra crit range)to augment the theme related abilities which is to deliver a powerful and hopefully critical smite. Since CoT can be dropped to 18, once one goes WM 7, Paladin can be increased to 15 at basically no cost. The great smiting feats loss cost is hence minimized to GS-V vs GS-X against the net increase in AB (+3), crit range (17-20 vs 20) and smites a day (3x/day vs 1x/day), not to mention the extra spells and capped spell effects and divine shield which increase both the attack potential (and hence damage output) and the defenses of the build. Consider the original is a one trick pony: this takes that concept and turns it into a playable build.

Losing a further GS in favor of more spells seems to betray the build's concept. The extra spells here were acquired basically free of charge once the WM 7 route had been chosen, in your suggestion they would detract from the build's focus. Mind me, the suggestion is good, but this is no generic build. And it belongs together with going for scimitar vs scythe or AS vs GS-V, as options available if one wants to further walk away from the damage adept. I mean, when making suggestions for this build, keep present the original Damage Adept as your reference point and do not start from this build alone or you'll lose perspective. That said, I guess I'll have to post the Paladin 23/CoT 10 version I have too, as a stand alone build (you know what they say Max, great minds think alike so I was there too on my own)

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
If you should choose Scythe in the GrimSmiter, he'll do much more damage on a crit than this WM version, while being about the same in terms of playability I'd say.

So what I am trying to say is that WM cost you Crit damage, it increases your number of crits.
That said, crit range is worth a lot more in the case of smites, seeing as even the scimitar version, which does the least damage of the lot, one-shots most opponents.

Aye, since you go for GS X the base damage on a smite is almost 200 points higher which is more than enough to offset the x4 vs x5 crit multiplier, but of course you would crit less often. What I'd like to see is ways to increase the damage (GS feats) on this one without affecting playability, ideas?

Me I was thinking of dropping DS, Moving either Extra Smites or IC preepic, start with 15 Cha and 8 Con, move Paladin 13-14 before CoT 10 and finally grab GS with CoT 10 bonus feat at lvl 31.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
If you look at the two builds, their performance is uncannily equal. Mine has BF/KD whereas yours has WM crits. That aside, differences are really minor. The differences in choice of weapons can't really be counted in.

DS is just about the only feat I can see that can be left out in your case. Have you run the numbers on Greataxe? That would save another feat for GS. Exotic, WM, Great Smiting, it all starts to cost when you on top of that must have IC.
